paper_abstract: This paper describes the application of the least-squares spectral element method to compressible flow problems. Special attention is paid to the imposition of the weak boundary conditions along curved walls and the influence of the time step on the position and resolution of shocks. The method is described and results are presented for a supersonic flow over a wedge and subsonic, transonic and Supersonic flow problems over a bump. Copyright (C) 2008 John Wiley & Sons, Ltd.
paper_title: Least-squares spectral element method applied to the Euler equations
